subject: Mental Health
title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
description: A 60-second lesson on Generalized Anxiety Disorder.

hook.text: Imagine worrying about everything â€” money, health, family â€” all day, every day.

buildup.text: GAD is a persistent state of dread that latches onto whatever is nearby.

discovery.text: The worry isn't about one thing; the brain cycles endlessly between topics.

twist.text: People with GAD often appear calm on the outside while spiraling inside.

climax.text: Diagnosis requires at least six months of excessive, hard-to-control worry.

punchline.text: The worry machine doesn't need fuel to run.

quiz.question: How long must excessive worry persist to diagnose GAD?
